title: Vicious brawl breaks out between two women in beauty shop after 'heated row'
text:

A vicious brawl broke out between two women in a beauty shop.

Footage of the scrap was filmed at the nail and beauty salon Ai to Ai in Aberdeen market, Scotland.

The clip was posted to Snapchat and shows three women involved in a heated exchange before two of them start fighting.

Staff said they were left terrified when the brawl erupted between the two, who they say appeared to know each other.

One was already in the store finishing getting her eyebrows done when the other reportedly entered with her mum and a baby in a pram around midday.

Owners Uzma Naz says they then began fighting out of nowhere.

(Image: Snapchat)

She told the Daily Record : "One customer was in getting her eyebrows done and was about to finish when another lady with her mum and a child in a buggy came in.

"She was just about to leave when they just started fighting - I have no idea why!

"It looked as though they knew each and had some kind of issue. The security guards at the market were called and they were chucked out.

"They've also been banned from the market."

In the clip, tempers boil over as one of the women, wearing a black jacket, points her finger in another's face as they start shouting.

Punches then fly as the pair lunge at each other as an older lady - dubbed the "white coated wonder woman" online - tries to break up the brawl by getting in between them.

She manages to cool things down as the two would-be boxers seperate.

(Image: Snapchat)

Security was then called and the pair were chucked out and banned from the Aberdeen Indoor Market in the city centre.

Commenting on the video on Twitter , @byshannonc said: "Reason 816282 on why not to go in to the market."

While Maria Tamkun wrote: “Hahahaha imagine us getting our nails done and seeing that.”

And @fitabootit posted: “Excellent peacekeeper skills by white coated wonder woman.”

Now the salon have told how they fear their small business will be given a "bad name" following the incident.

Uzma added: "The fight had nothing to do with our salon.

"We're a small business struggling to get by and things like this just give us such a bad name.

"The incident was very loud and a lot of people who noticed it came in to our store, including other shops, asking us about it as if it's our fault.

"We work really hard to bring customers to our store and it hurts us. We don't want people seeing the viral video and thinking it happened because we had done something."

Police Scotland said they had no reports of the incident.
description: Footage of the scrap was taken at the nail and beauty salon Ai to Ai in Aberdeen market, Scotland - and showed the women in a heated exchange before they start fighting
